content:
Diagnosis:
Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma right temple
T2N0M0, Stage II
PD-L1 CPS 25

Previous treatment:
Wide local excision March 2024
Post-operative radiotherapy 50Gy in 20 fractions completed May 2024

Current medications:
None cancer-related

Allergies:
No known drug allergies

Current situation:
Post-treatment review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy. The surgical site has healed well with minimal scarring. She reports no ongoing pain or sensitivity at the treatment site. Her energy levels have returned to normal following radiotherapy completion. Performance status remains 0.

The most recent CT neck performed on 15 June 2024 shows no evidence of regional recurrence or distant metastases. Blood tests including renal function are satisfactory.

Plan is for ongoing surveillance with 3-monthly clinical reviews for the first year. I have provided written information about sun protection and skin self-examination. Next appointment arranged for September 2024 with repeat CT neck prior to review.

cancer_timeline.value: CT neck shows no evidence of regional recurrence or distant metastases

patient_facts.value: Blood tests including renal function satisfactory

status_updates.value: Stage II cutaneous SCC treated with surgery and adjuvant radiotherapy. Post-treatment review shows good recovery with no evidence of recurrence
Surgical site healed well with minimal scarring, no ongoing pain or sensitivity
Energy levels returned to normal following radiotherapy completion
CT neck prior to next review
3-monthly clinical reviews for the first year, next appointment September 2024
